definitions.definition: a sudden violent twist or pull.
examples: with a wrench Tony wriggled free
synonyms: heave; informalyank "she felt a wrench on her shoulders"

definitions.definition: a feeling of sadness or distress caused by one's own or another's departure.
examples: it will be a real wrench to leave after eight years

definitions.definition: a tool used for gripping and turning nuts, bolts, pipes, etc.
examples: monkey wrench hold the piston with a wrench

definitions.definition: a combination of a couple with a force along its axis.
pull or twist (someone or something) suddenly and violently.
examples: Casey grabbed the gun and wrenched it upward from my hand
synonyms: jimmy; informalyank "he wrenched the gun from her hand"

definitions.definition: injure (a part of the body) as a result of a sudden twisting movement.
examples: she slipped and wrenched her ankle

definitions.definition: turn (something, especially a nut or bolt) with a wrench.
distort to fit a particular theory or interpretation.
examples: to wrench our Bible to make it fit a misconception of facts
